fullText: Read More About: Amy Herzog, An Enemy Of The People, Jeremy Strong, Michael Imperioli Jump to Comments ‘An Enemy of the People’ Review: An Actorly, Broadway Face-Off Between Jeremy Strong and Michael Imperioli Circle in the Square, 828 seats, $231 top. Opened March 18, 2024. Review March 16. Running time: 2 HOURS 15 MIN. Production: A Seaview, Patrick Catullo, Plan B, Roth-Manella Productions, Eric & Marsi Gardiner, John Gore Organization, James L. Nederlander, Jon. B Platt, Atekwana Hutton, Bob Boyett, Chris & Ashlee Clarke, Cohen-Demar Productions, Andrew Diamond, G16 Productions, Sony Music Masterworks, Triptyk Studios, Trunfio Ryan, Kate Cannova and DJL Productions presentation of a play in two acts by Henrik Ibsen in a new version by Amy Herzog. Crew: Directed by Sam Gold. Sets, dots; costumes, David Zinn; lights, Isabella Byrd; sound, Mikaal Sulaiman, production stage manager, Rachel Bauer. Cast: Jeremy Strong, Michael Imperioli, Katie Broad, Bill Buell, Caleb Eberhardt, Matthew August Jeffers, David Patrick Kelly, David Mattar Merten, Victoria Pedretti, Max Roll, Thomas Jay Ryan, Alan Tong.
dtliExcerpt: Strong's performance is commanding and nuanced, bringing a contemporary urgency to Ibsen's prescient tale of truth versus power.
showScoreExcerpt: Strong's performance is commanding and nuanced, bringing a contemporary urgency to Ibsen's prescient tale of truth versus power.

llmScore.reasoning: [ensemble-unanimous] | All 3 models agree: Positive | Claude: Despite extensive critical analysis and some reservations about the adaptation's choices, the critic explicitly states the production 'has much to recommend it' and praises Strong's performance as worthy of future stage work, indicating a clear positive recommendation. | GPT-4o: The review praises the production's use of the theater's unique structure, the performances, particularly Jeremy Strong's, and the thematic richness of the adaptation. Despite some minor reservations about the adaptation's approach, the overall tone is enthusiastic and recommends the show. | Gemini: The review is largely positive, highlighting strong performances and effective staging, but it also expresses reservations about the adaptation's approach to the central conflict. The final recommendation is positive but not without caveats.
